Class
Description
AccelerationAheadTransformer
 
AccelerationTransformer
Transformer representing constant acceleration.
Alarm
Used to enable timed events.
AlarmAdapter
This class is used to make something happen at a particular time.
AlarmScheduler
This interface contains all of the methods for scheduling and cancelling alarms.
AnimationCanvas
This class is a JPanel that contains Sprites.

The license below must remain in the software unaltered.
ArcSprite
This class represents a circular arc as a Sprite.
AttractTransformer
 
BounceClassTransformer
Bounce controlled sprite off of all sprites of a given class.

BounceSpriteTransformer
 
BounceTransformer
Shared root for all Bounce transformers.
Box2D
Box2D is, effectively, a Rectangle2D for use in fang2.

ButtonSprite
 
Client
The Client traps input from the user and sends it to the Server asynchronously.
ColorTransformer
 
CompositeSprite
A CompositeSprite that contains a group of sprites; individual sprites are positioned relative to the origin of the composite (they can be translated, rotate, or scaled relative to the CompositeSprites origin and scale).
DialogPanel
 
DOSCommandLine
Win32 command-line parameter finding routine.
ErrorConsole
Displays runtime errors in a meaningful way.
ErrorException
This class allows errors to be reported in a consistent way.
FangPackageGenerator
This class moves and refactors all of the packaged classes into the single package fang for easy importing.
FrameAdvancer
used to advance the frame in an animation using the AnimationCanvas.
FunButton
This class represents a button which can animate the background and also resize the font with changes in the button size.
FunComboBox
This class represents a text field which can animate the background.
FunFrame
This class represents a frame which can animate the background.
FunPainter
 
FunPanel
This class represents a frame which can animate the background.
FunTextField
This class represents a text field which can animate the background.
Game
The class representing a FANG video game.
GameConnections
The GameConnections store the input and output connections to the Client.
GameLevel
This class mimics the GameLoop.
GameLoop
This class adds mouse and keyboard interaction to FrameAdvancer and also provides a method for sending Objects to the other clients.
GameRedirection
This class redirects all method calls to the originally extended JApplet.
GameWindow
Driver for the GameLoop.
HitClassTransformer
 
HitSpriteTransformer
 
HitTarget
 
HTMLDisplay
Displays an html file in a JDialog box.
HttpServer
This establishes incoming connections and directs them to the appropriate GameConnection.
HttpServerSocket
 
ImageSprite
This class takes an image and transforms it into a Sprite.
InitializeApplication
InitializeApplication is a static class which provides the fangMain method.
InputStringField
This is a text input widget.
InputStringSprite
This is a StringSprite that changes when text is typed on it.
InterpolatorTransformer
 
Keyboard
This class uses polling rather than events for keyboard input.
KeyboardTransformer
Decorate a TransformerAdapter so that it runs forward or backward for any frame only when appropriate keys are pressed.
LineSprite
This sprite draws a line between two points.
Location2D
This class represents an (x, y) coordinate within some space.
MidiSound
 
Mouse
Stores the mouse positions and clicks for use in the gaming engine.
MouseClickTransformer
 
MouseClickTransformerListener
 
MouseMovementTransformer
 
MouseMovementTransformerListener
 
OutlineSprite
 
OvalSprite
This class represents an oval sprite.
Palette
This utility class provides easy access to colors by name (either an X Windows named color (see http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/X11_color_names), FANG Blue (the FANG default color), SCG Red (the red used in the first edition of Simple Computer Games) or a hexadecimal string as Web page colors are specified.
PieSprite
This class represents a wedge of pie as a Sprite.
Platform
This class contains methods to support platform-specific code.
Player
Collects player information such as the mouse, keyboard, and message.
PlayerNameInput
This Game is for getting the players to enter their names.
PolygonSprite
A sprite representing a filled, closed polygon.
PolyLineSprite
A sprite composed of line and curve segments.
PrettyStringSprite
This class converts text into a sprite.
Proxy
This class simply forwards messages to and from a client and web server.
RawMediaCache
This class facilitates loading and caching content from a URL off the main execution thread.
RawMediaCache.MediaLoadListener
 
RectangleSprite
This class represents a rectangular sprite.
RepelTransformer
 
SampledSound
Plays mp3 and wav files.
ScaleTransformer
 
SequentialSound
This class can play only one sound at a time.
Server
This establishes incoming connections and directs them to the appropriate GameConnection.
Shootable
 
Shooter
 
ShooterTransformer
 
Size2D
This class encapsulates a width and a height dimension.
Sound
This class that is capable of playing sampled sounds and MIDIs.
SpeedAheadTransformer
 
SpinAccelerationTransformer
A "spinner" TransformerAdapter.
SpinTransformer
A "spinner" TransformerAdapter.
Sprite
This class provides a structure for representing sprites which have size, shape, orientation, and color.
StringSprite
This class converts text into a sprite.
TimeLimitedTransformer
 
Transformer
An interface for objects which provide behaviors.
TransformerAdapter
The base class for all next generation transformers.
Vector2D
This class represents a vector (direction and magnitude) within some space.
VelocityProvider
 
VelocityTransformer
Constant linear velocity TransformerAdapter.
WindowPositioning
WindowPositioning - utility functions for positioning windows relative to other windows.
WrapTransformer
A transformer which wraps the sprite around the screen.
